data.title: CURRENT REALITY
questions: In this phase, get them to describe the current state of their career.
What's up? What’s your current thinking about your career?
What’s prompted you to focus on your career at this time?
What about your current job do you like? And want to continue?
In an ideal world, what about your current job would you change?
What do you see as your key strengths, talents and capabilities?
Thinking of previous jobs, what did you especially enjoy doing?
What work do you not like? What about it do you not enjoy?
How is your view of your career impacting your satisfaction?

data.title: IDEAL
questions: In this phase, get them to explore what gives them meaning/purpose.
What makes work personally meaningful for you?
What do you see as your purpose professionally?
if clear) To what extent are you fully living that purpose?
(if not clear) How might you get a clearer sense of your purpose?
What do you dream of doing? What would you do if there were no limits?
To what kind of work are you drawn? What about it appeals to you?
What do you perceive is missing in your current role? Or not fully realized?
In what ways might you leverage more of your talents in your current role?
What matters most to you at work? What are your ‘must-have’s?
(Consider the Career Anchors® assessment to explore your career values.)
How would you characterize your ideal work life?
How clear are you on your ideal career? What more do you need to reflect on?

data.title: ENERGY
questions: In this phase, get them to express what energizes and motivates them.
What are you passionate about career-wise? What energizes you?
What intrinsically motivates you? (autonomy, mastery, purpose, etc.)
What aspects of a work situation are important to you? (location, environment, etc.)
How important is the culture? The person you’d be working for?
What other factors impact your energy on the job?
What further career help/support do you need? Who could provide that?

data.title: GAPS + SUCCESS
questions: In this phase, get them to clarify career success and direction.
How would you define ‘career success’? Be specific.
On a scale of 1 – 10, how clear is your career direction?
What would make you rate it a ‘10’? How will you get clearer?
(Once clear) What will be key to success in your desired field?
What new competencies, skills, knowledge will you need?
What transferable skills do you have?
Where are your gaps (in knowledge/skill)?
How might you close those gaps?
Who might you talk to in your target organization?
What would you ask them specifically?
Who might you talk to about your desired role?
What would you ask them specifically?
What support do you need to reach your goal?
Where can you get that?

data.title: GOAL + PLAN
questions: In this phase, get them to commit to actions.
What’s a clear, immediate goal? How will you achieve it?
What’s your plan? When will you start?
What’s your first step? When will you do that?
